intro: Mentha arvensis f. cuneisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf field mint, is a variant of the common mint plant. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and aromatic, slightly minty scent. This plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland areas and along stream banks. It has square stems and produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. The leaves are often used in herbal teas and for their medicinal properties.
